title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and relatively casual. Interviewed with the person who would be the position's direct supervisor and the person above them. The experience might be different depending on the department.
Interview Questions: How can you apply what you are studying in your program to this position?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process with many opportunities to grow.  If you are able to join the team you will learn many things about the school, be able to add to your resume, and a bit of customer service experience.

title: Manager, International and Graduate Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stetson University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
A series of three interviews. A phone interview, sparklier video recording and a zoom meeting with three individuals from the department. All very nice and sincere. I didn't feel that they had the expertise to grow the program like their vision and because of that I wasn't the right fit for the role despite being offered an in person visit, with the offer to pay for travel expenses (flight) to take a tour and meet them in person.
They asked simple questions about how I could grow the program during Covid.I was off put by the dean who hardly spoke despite having a 1:1 meeting for thirty minutes. That was alarming as it seemed he was so far removed from the team, that he had such little input, direction or vision. Some may find that as an asset in a job but form past experience I found that to be alarming and lacked expertise necessary to drive change, something I look for in a great leader.
Interview Questions:
where do you see yourself in 5 years?

How will you recruit students during the pandemic?

How will you connect with overseas populations?

title: Fitness Coach (Student) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions, such as strengths and weaknesses. What do you as a student want out of the process?  My interview was over the summer through zoom. It was super easy and simple.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Paint Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was extremely laid back. It was led by the boss, Julie as well as another member of the team. It was a casual experience and felt very welcoming from the jump.
Interview Questions: What made you choose paint crew?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: This was a very difficult process. I had a 10 minute screening, 30 minute hirevue (recorded answers then send it to HR), 30 minute zoom interview with a committee of 6, and All day zoom with multiple departments with no break
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to work with people from different backgrounds.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stetson University
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute zoom interview with 3 people, the director and two staff from other depts. Two other committee members were not there. The position was described and the interviewers took turns asking set questions. Final question was if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: As administrative support, how will you support/promote diversity and inclusion.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stetson University
Interview Descriptions: Quick process, hour interview with director and staff. Simple questions, did not require portfolio. Campus tour following interview. Hired within two weeks - HR was slow in getting paperwork. No negotiation.
Interview Questions: Background and experience with position details.

title: Recycling Team - Student Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Recycling Coordinator in conference room.  It may have current staff interviewing as well to give the interviewer an opportunity to ask questions to another student.  Very welcoming & comfortable environment.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself & why do you want to join the recycling Team?

title: Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview followed by on campus interview. During the on campus interview a presentation was required and a variety of questions were asked to gauge how I would fit in to the current dynamic.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you have had to make a difficult decision.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The questions were very basic (cookie-cutter) and did not touch on my skills or abilities. It was very one-sided. The interviewers seemed bored. I was not allowed to ask questions at the end and was actually rushed out the door. I was brought in for a "second interview" which turned out to be the job offer. The salary was firmly non-negotiable: take it or leave it.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength/What is your greatest weakness; Where do you see yourself in five years; Why do you want to work here, What do you know about Stetson

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stetson University (Gulfport, FL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called over the phone and asked questions about how I qualify for the job. This was through their HR department. A few days later I got a call requesting that I prepare a 5 minute presentation in 1.5 days. On the day of the presentation, I went to HR and they brought me to the library to meet the other members of the office and give the presentation. Before actually giving the presentation, they go to know me better. I elaborated on all my experience and passion for this particular field. The following Monday I got an offer. I started about two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your presentation experience.

title: Web Applications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stetson University in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: This was a panel interview. The questions were run-of-the-mill and read from a printed sheet. They included your greatest weakness, etc. No surprises. The second interview was the actual job offer. Salary is not discussed until the second interview. I was given a figure that could not be negotiated, which was odd.
Interview Questions: "Why should we believe you won't leave after one year?"

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stetson University (De Land, FL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Intensive. Full day of interiews with various departments. Difficult to always know who I was talking to/why, but it was abundantly clear that there was cohesion among different offices. Was asked to give a presentation for a group of people from student life. Met with faculty, students, and coaches.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you align with Stetson's values?

title: Lead Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual since all the professors knew me and my work ethic. I just had to explain why I thought I would be best for the role over a fellow student
Interview Questions: How would I improve the Math Clinic?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stetson University (Deland, FL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was run by the department supervisor and a student employee. The student employee was there for no reason and wasted time asking pointless questions. The interview was about half an hour long and very simple. The interview was not challenging and mostly consisted of the supervisor telling me how to do an online personality quiz.
Interview Questions: Have you ever used a computer

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stetson University (Gulfport, FL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was called and set up an appointment for an in-person intervene.  I met with what would be my immediate supervisor.  I was asked basic questions: tell me about yourself, your experience related to this job, where you see yourself in the future, what do you enjoy about this position.  Then we chatted briefly as we got along well.
Interview Questions: The questions were very simple and I didn't find any of them to be difficult.  Maybe where I saw myself in the future, probably because I was still young and wasn't sure.
